result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman Scott Barksdale

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Norman Scott Barksdale.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing remains scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court scheduled a bail/bond hearing upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of date.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Defense's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Norman Scott Barksdale not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer G. Yahr.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appears in person the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Romenesko fail to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Kohls Department Store, 5650 N. Bayshore Dr., Glendale
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Norman Scott Barksdale in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Norman Scott Barksdale appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
